document_data.name: ''Harp of Stars''
document_data.creator: [[Elminster]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''''Harp of Stars''''' was an [[Item enchantment|enchanted]] [[harp]] crafted by [[Elminster Aumar]] to counter the threat posed by the mysterious [[malaugrym]]s in the late 12{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Powers:
When played, the ''Harp of Stars'' made [[Shapechange|shapeshifting]] easier by weakening the life energies that bound living bodies together, thus allowing the owner of the harp to manipulate their body more effectively. When wielded by a natural [[shapechanger]], such as a malaugrym, this allowed them to assume larger and more powerful forms than they would have otherwise been able. However, over time the harp's [[magic]] had the effect of weakening the wielder's body and thus making any transformations more unstable.

The ''Harp of Stars'' had an additional set of enchantments designed to make it a powerful tool for subterfuge. First, it possessed the property of acting as a beacon to allow it to be tracked, but this feature was quite obvious to any sophisticated user and could be easily deactivated. However, a far less obvious second enchantment would instantly recorded the thoughts and memories of any creature that deactivated the beacon, thus turning it into a trap. With these enchantments in place, Elminster hoped to trick the malaugrym into revealing the secrets about who and what they really were.
document_data.History:
Following the reappearance of the malaugrym in the {{YearlinkName|1179}}, Elminster and [[Khelben Arunsun]] determined that they were a threat that needed to be addressed. At the same time, the two [[wizard]]s were looking to restructure the [[Harpers]] organization, believing it to be too large and too dependent on powerful members like themselves. Elminster devised a plan to address both of these issues by crafting the ''Harp of Stars''.

Around the {{YearlinkName|1182}},

Khelben ended the war in in the {{YearlinkName|1222}}, by taking over the mind of the malaugrym leader, the [[Shadowmaster]], and convincing the remaining malaugryms to withdraw. Khelben used the Shadowmaster to retrieve the ''Harp of Stars'', however another malaugrym who aspired to seize the title of Shadomaster for itself attacked and slew the old leader, nearly incapacitating Khelben with the backlash. The ''Harp of Stars'' was never seen again, and was presumed to be either destroyed or lost on some far off [[plane]].
